name: Eth.Sentry.Tx

aliases.name: CustomSend
aliases.comment:
onSign : Message after metamask/wallet has signed tx and returned tx hash
    onBroadcast : Message after tx is confirmed sitting in tx queue on the node
    onMined : ( message after tx is mined,
                (number of blocks deep to watch tx, message on each mined block after tx is sent - stops sending messages when first tuple value is reached)
              )
aliases.type: { onSign : Maybe.Maybe (Result.Result String Eth.Types.TxHash -> msg) , onBroadcast : Maybe.Maybe (Result.Result String Eth.Types.Tx -> msg) , onMined : Maybe.Maybe ( Result.Result String Eth.Types.TxReceipt -> msg , Maybe.Maybe { confirmations : Int, toMsg : Eth.Sentry.Tx.TxTracker -> msg } ) }

aliases.name: InPort
aliases.comment:
The `txIn` subscription.
Where information from the outside comes IN to your elm app.
Used for getting the TxHash response from Metamask, or other wallets.

     port txIn : (Value -> msg) -> Sub msg

aliases.name: OutPort
aliases.comment:
The `txOut` port.
Where information from your elm app is sent OUT to javascript land.
Used for sending `Send` Tx parameters to Metamask, or other wallets.

    port txOut : Value -> Cmd msg

aliases.name: TxTracker
aliases.comment: For checking whether a tx has reached a certain block depth (# of confirmations) in a customSend
aliases.type: { currentDepth : Int , minedInBlock : Int , stopWatchingAtBlock : Int , lastCheckedBlock : Int , txHash : Eth.Types.TxHash , doneWatching : Bool , reOrg : Bool }

name: Eth
comment:
Ethereum RPC Methods

See the [official docs][rpc-docs] for reference.

[rpc-docs]: [https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC]


# Contracts

Make sure to use the [elm-ethereum-generator](https://github.com/cmditch/elm-ethereum-generator)
to auto-generate the necessary `Elm <-> Contract` interface from a contract's ABI.

If you're making Eth transactions, you'll need to build a `Call`,
convert it to a `Send`, and use `Eth.Sentry.Tx` to hand it off to your browser's wallet (e.g., MetaMask, Trust).

    ( newSentry, sentryCmd ) =
        myCallParams
            |> Eth.toSend
            |> TxSentry.send TxSendResponse model.txSentry

@docs call, estimateGas, getStorageAt, getCode, callAtBlock, getStorageAtBlock, getCodeAtBlock


# Transactions

@docs getTx, getTxReceipt, toSend, encodeSend, sendTx, sendRawTx, getTxByBlockHashAndIndex, getTxByBlockNumberAndIndex


# Address/Accounts

@docs getBalance, getTxCount, getBalanceAtBlock, getTxCountAtBlock


# Blocks

@docs getBlockNumber, getBlock, getBlockByHash, getBlockWithTxObjs, getBlockByHashWithTxObjs, getBlockTxCount, getBlockTxCountByHash, getUncleCount, getUncleCountByHash, getUncleAtIndex, getUncleByBlockHashAtIndex


# Filter/Logs/Events

If you have access to a websocket RPC endpoint, it's much easier to just use `Eth.Sentry.Event`.
Geth, Parity, and Infura support websockets.

@docs getLogs, newFilter, newBlockFilter, newPendingTxFilter, getFilterChanges, getFilterLogs, uninstallFilter


# Misc

@docs sign, protocolVersion, syncing, coinbase, mining, hashrate, gasPrice, accounts

values.name: accounts
values.comment: Returns a list of addresses owned by client.

values.name: call
values.comment:
Call a function on an Ethereum contract.
Useful for reading data from contracts, or simulating a transaction before doing a real `Send`.

Use the [elm-ethereum-generator](https://github.com/cmditch/elm-ethereum-generator) code generator to produce an interface for a smart contract from it's ABI.

**Note** The decoder for a call is baked into the Call record to allow for a smoother developer experience.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Call a -> Task.Task Http.Error a

values.name: callAtBlock
values.comment: Call a function on an Ethereum contract from a particular point in history.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Call a -> Eth.Types.BlockId -> Task.Task Http.Error a

values.name: coinbase
values.comment: Get the client's coinbase address.

values.name: encodeSend
values.comment: Useful if your handling txParams in javascript land yourself.

values.name: estimateGas
values.comment:
Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete.

**Note** that the estimate may be significantly more than the amount of gas actually used by the transaction,
for a variety of reasons including EVM mechanics and node performance.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Call a -> Task.Task Http.Error Int

values.name: gasPrice
values.comment:
Get the current price per gas in wei

**Note**: not always accurate. See EthGasStation website

values.name: getBalance
values.comment:
Get the balance of a given address/account.
Returns Wei amount as BigInt

values.name: getBalanceAtBlock
values.comment: Get the balance of a given address/account, at a certain block height
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Address -> Eth.Types.BlockId -> Task.Task Http.Error BigInt.BigInt

values.name: getBlock
values.comment:
Get information about a block given a valid block number.

The transactions field will be an array of TxHash's mined during this block.

values.name: getBlockByHash
values.comment: Get information about a block given a valid block hash.

values.name: getBlockByHashWithTxObjs
values.comment:
See `getBlockWithTxObjs` above.

Uses block hash instead of number for the identifier.

values.name: getBlockNumber
values.comment: Get the block number of the most recently mined block.

values.name: getBlockTxCount
values.comment: Get the number of transactions in a block from a given block number.

values.name: getBlockTxCountByHash
values.comment: Get the number of transactions in a block from a given block hash.

values.name: getBlockWithTxObjs
values.comment:
Get information about a block given a valid block number.

The transactions field will be an array of `Tx` objects instead of TxHash's.

values.name: getCode
values.comment: Returns the bytecode from a contract at a given contract's address.

values.name: getCodeAtBlock
values.comment: Returns the bytecode from a contract at a given address, at a certain block height.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Address -> Eth.Types.BlockId -> Task.Task Http.Error String

values.name: getFilterChanges
values.comment:
Polling method for a filter, which returns an array of logs which occurred since last poll.

Use the correct decoder for the given filter type:

For a `newFilter`:

    import Eth.Decode as Decode
    import Eth.Evm.Decode as Evm
    import Json.Decode exposing (Decoder)
    import Json.Decode.Pipeline exposing (custom)

    transferEventDecoder : Decoder (Event Erc20Transfer)
    transferEventDecoder =
        Decode.event erc20TransferDecoder

    type alias Erc20Transfer =
        { from : Address
        , to : Address
        , value : BigInt
        }

    erc20TransferDecoder : Decoder Erc20Transfer
    erc20TransferDecoder =
        decode Transfer
            |> custom (Evm.topic 1 Evm.address)
            |> custom (Evm.topic 2 Evm.address)
            |> custom (Evm.data 0 Evm.uint)

For a `newBlockFilter`:

    newBlockDecoder : Decoder BlockHead
    newBlockDecoder =
        Eth.Decode.blockHead

For a `newPendingTxFilter`:

    newPendingTxDecoder : Decoder TxHash
    newPendingTxDecoder =
        Eth.Decode.tx
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Json.Decode.Decoder a -> Eth.Types.FilterId -> Task.Task Http.Error (List a)

values.name: getFilterLogs
values.comment: Returns an array of all logs matching filter with given id. See above note on decoders.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Json.Decode.Decoder a -> Eth.Types.FilterId -> Task.Task Http.Error (List a)

values.name: getLogs
values.comment:
Get an array of all logs matching a given filter object.
Most likely you won't need this, as they are generated for you in [elm-ethereum-generator](https://github.com/cmditch/elm-ethereum-generator)

values.name: getStorageAt
values.comment:
Returns the value from a storage position at a given address.
See Ethereum JSON-RPC methods for specification on retrieving data from complex data structures like maps.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Address -> Int -> Task.Task Http.Error String

values.name: getStorageAtBlock
values.comment: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address, at a certain block height.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Address -> Int -> Eth.Types.BlockId -> Task.Task Http.Error String

values.name: getTx
values.comment:
Get transaction information from it's hash.
Includes pre-execution info: value, nonce, data/input, gas, gasPrice, to, and from.

values.name: getTxByBlockHashAndIndex
values.comment: Get a transaction by it's index in a certain block given the block hash.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.BlockHash -> Int -> Task.Task Http.Error Eth.Types.Tx

values.name: getTxByBlockNumberAndIndex
values.comment: Get a transaction by it's index in a certain block given the block number.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Int -> Int -> Task.Task Http.Error Eth.Types.Tx

values.name: getTxCount
values.comment: Get the number of transactions sent from a given address/account.

values.name: getTxCountAtBlock
values.comment: Get the number of transactions sent from a given address/account at a given block height.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Address -> Eth.Types.BlockId -> Task.Task Http.Error Int

values.name: getTxReceipt
values.comment:
Get the receipt of a transaction from it's hash.
Only exists after the transaction has been mined!

Includes post-execution info: gasUsed, cumulativeGasUsed, contractAddress, logs, logsBloom.
Also includes the tx execution status (only if block is post-byzantium).

values.name: getUncleAtIndex
values.comment: Get information about an uncle given it's index in a block by block number
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Int -> Int -> Task.Task Http.Error Eth.Types.Uncle

values.name: getUncleByBlockHashAtIndex
values.comment: Get information about an uncle given it's index in a block by block hash
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.BlockHash -> Int -> Task.Task Http.Error Eth.Types.Uncle

values.name: getUncleCount
values.comment: Get the number of uncles in a given block given a block number.

values.name: getUncleCountByHash
values.comment: Get the number of uncles in a given block given a block hash.

values.name: hashrate
values.comment: Returns the number of hashes per second that the node is mining with.

values.name: mining
values.comment: See whether or not a given node is mining.

values.name: newBlockFilter
values.comment:
Creates a filter in the node to notify when a new block arrives.
To check if the state has changed, call getFilterChanges.

values.name: newFilter
values.comment:
Establishes a filter object on a given node.
Useful for contract events.

To check if the state has changed, call getFilterChanges.

values.name: newPendingTxFilter
values.comment:
Creates a filter in the node to notify when new pending transactions arrive.
To check if the state has changed, call getFilterChanges.

values.name: protocolVersion
values.comment: Get the current ethereum protocol version.

values.name: sendRawTx
values.comment: Broadcast a signed and RLP encoded transaction.

values.name: sendTx
values.comment:
Execute a transaction on chain.
Only useful if your keys live on the node your talking too, which is generally considered very poor practice.

NOTE: You probably don't need this.
If you're writing a proper dApp, look at using the `Eth.Sentry.Tx` to interface with wallets like MetaMask.

values.name: sign
values.comment:
Sign an arbitrary chunk of N bytes.

The sign method calculates an Ethereum specific signature with: sign(keccak256("\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n" + len(message) + message))).

By adding a prefix to the message makes the calculated signature recognisable as an Ethereum specific signature.
This prevents misuse where a malicious DApp can sign arbitrary data (e.g. transaction) and use the signature to impersonate the victim.

**Note** the address to sign with must be unlocked.
values.type: Eth.Types.HttpProvider -> Eth.Types.Address -> String -> Task.Task Http.Error String

values.name: syncing
values.comment:
Get the sync status of a particular node.

    Nothing == Not Syncing
    Just SyncStatus == starting, current, and highestBlock

values.name: toSend
values.comment:
Prepare a Call to be executed on chain.
Used in `Eth.Sentry.Tx`, a means to interact with MetaMask.

values.name: uninstallFilter
values.comment:
Uninstalls a filter with given id.
Should always be called when watch is no longer needed.
Additonally Filters timeout when they aren't requested with eth_getFilterChanges for a period of time.

name: Evm.Encode

types.name: Encoding
types.comment:
Not yet implemented :

    -- DO NOT USE
    DBytesE, BytesE, StringE, ListE

name: Eth.Utils

values.name: addressToChecksumString
values.comment:
Convert an Address to a string conforming to the EIP-55 checksum.

**Note**: This lowercases all the characters inside the `Address` and runs it through the checksum algorithm.

values.name: addressToString
values.comment: Convert an Address to a String

values.name: blockHashToString
values.comment: Convert a given BlockHash to a string.

values.name: functionSig
values.comment:
Convert a contract function name to it's 4-byte function signature.

    Utils.functionSig "transfer(address,uint256)" == (Hex "a9059cbb")

values.name: hexAppend
values.comment:
Append two Hex's together.

    hexAppend (Hex 0x12) (Hex 0x34) == Hex 0x1234

values.name: hexConcat
values.comment:
Concatenate a list of Hex's

    hexConcat [ Hex 0x12, Hex 0x34, Hex 0x56 ] == Hex 0x123456

values.name: hexToAscii
values.comment: Convert Given Hex into ASCII. Will fail if Hex is an uneven length.

values.name: hexToString
values.comment: Convert a `Hex` into a string.

values.name: hexToUtf8
values.comment: Convert Given Hex into UTF8. Will fail if Hex is an uneven length.

values.name: ipfsHashToString
values.comment: Convert an IPFSHash to a string.

values.name: ipfsToBytes32
values.comment:
Prepares IPFS Hash to store as soldity bytes32

**Note**: This assumes a SHA256 IPFS hash is used and chops off the "Qm".
An "opinionated" feature of this library that helps save gas costs
by avoiding the more expensive dynamic types like `string` or `bytes`.
The "Qm" is there to help future proof IPFS, and allow for other hashing algorithms to be used.

    U.toIPFSHash "QmNXnCWPS2szLaQGVA6TFtiUAJB2YnFTJJFTXPGuc4wocQ"
        |> Result.map U.ipfsToBytes32

    > Ok (Hex "02d9db84e21354dd4cc160eca9d13fa6f1b1bb44324013204098ae24090e717d")

Can be decoded safely decoded back to it's "Qm"-edness with `Evm.Decode.ipfsHash`.

values.name: isAddress
values.comment:
Check if given string is a valid address.

**Note**: Works on mixed case strings, with or without the 0x.

values.name: isBlockHash
values.comment:
Check if given string is a valid BlockHash.

i.e. Hex and 64 characters long.

values.name: isChecksumAddress
values.comment: Check if given string is a valid checksum address.

values.name: isHex
values.comment: Check if given string is valid Hex

values.name: isIPFSHash
values.comment: Check if given string is a valid IPFS Hash.

values.name: isSha256
values.comment: Checks if a given string is valid hex and 64 chars long.

values.name: isTxHash
values.comment:
Check if given string is a valid TxHash.

i.e. Hex and 64 characters long.

values.name: keccak256
values.comment: Hash a given string into it's SHA3/Keccak256 form.

values.name: lowLevelKeccak256
values.comment: Same as `ethereum_keccak_256` from [this](http://package.elm-lang.org/packages/prozacchiwawa/elm-keccak/latest) library.

values.name: retry
values.comment:
Retry a given `Task` till it succeeds, or runs out of time.

The below will wait for 5 minutes until giving up, and polls every 5 seconds.

    pollForMinedTx : HttpProvider -> TxHash -> Task Http.Error TxReceipt
    pollForMinedTx ethNode txHash =
        Eth.getTxReceipt ethNode txHash
            |> retry { attempts = 60, sleep = 5 }
values.type: Eth.Utils.Retry -> Task.Task x a -> Task.Task x a

values.name: toAddress
values.comment:
Safely convert a string into an address.

All lowercase or uppercase strings, shaped like addresses, will result in `Ok`.
Mixed case strings will return `Err` if the EIP-55 checksum is invalid.

values.name: toBlockHash
values.comment: Safely convert a given string to a BlockHash.

values.name: toHex
values.comment: Safely convert a string into Hex.

values.name: toIPFSHash
values.comment: Safely convert a stringy IPFS Hash to it's properly typed form.

values.name: toTxHash
values.comment: Safely convert a string to a TxHash.

values.name: txHashToString
values.comment: Convert a given TxHash to a string.

values.name: valueToMsg
values.comment:
Useful for decoding past a result straight into a Msg.
Comes in handy with Eth.Sentry.Event values.

    transferDecoder : Value -> Msg
    transferDecoder =
        valueToMsg Transfer Error transferEventDecoder

    type Msg
        = Transfer (Event Transfer)
        | Error String
values.type: (a -> msg) -> (String -> msg) -> Json.Decode.Decoder a -> Json.Encode.Value -> msg

name: Eth.Defaults

values.name: zeroAddress
values.comment:
Danger Will Robinson, why are you using this?
Only to burn things should it be used.

aliases.name: TxReceipt
aliases.type: { hash : Eth.Types.TxHash , index : Int , blockHash : Eth.Types.BlockHash , blockNumber : Int , gasUsed : BigInt.BigInt , cumulativeGasUsed : BigInt.BigInt , contractAddress : Maybe.Maybe Eth.Types.Address , logs : List Eth.Types.Log , logsBloom : String , root : Maybe.Maybe String , status : Maybe.Maybe Bool }

name: Eth.Units
comment:
Conversions and Helpers


# Concise Units

Useful helpers for concise value declarations.

    txParams : Send
    txParams =
        { to = Just myContract
        , from = Nothing
        , gas = Nothing
        , gasPrice = Just (gwei 3)
        , value = Just (eth 3)
        , data = Just data
        , nonce = Nothing
        }

@docs gwei, eth


# Precise Units

Helpers for dealing with floats.

@docs EthUnit, toWei, fromWei, bigIntToWei

types.name: EthUnit
types.comment:
Eth Unit
Useful for displaying to, and taking user input from, the UI

values.name: bigIntToWei
values.comment: Convert a given BigInt EthUnit to it's Wei equivalent

values.name: fromWei
values.comment:
Convert stringy Wei to a given EthUnit

    fromWei Gwei (BigInt.fromInt 123456789) == "0.123456789"
    fromWei Ether (BigInt.fromInt 123456789) == "0.000000000123456789"

**Note** Do not pass anything larger than MAX_SAFE_INTEGER into BigInt.fromInt
MAX_SAFE_INTEGER == 9007199254740991

values.name: toWei
values.comment:
Convert a given stringy EthUnit to it's Wei equivalent

    toWei Gwei "50" == Ok (BigInt.fromInt 50000000000)
    toWei Wei "40.9123" == Ok (BigInt.fromInt 40)
    toWei Kwei "40.9123" == Ok (BigInt.fromInt 40912)
    toWei Gwei "ten" == Err

name: Eth.RPC

aliases.name: RpcRequest
aliases.type: { url : String , method : String , params : List Json.Encode.Value , decoder : Json.Decode.Decoder a }
